cyclone.name: HUMBERTO
cyclone.current_location: about 320 mi SE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly northwestward across the north-west/central Bahamas, skirting the Florida east coast Saturday, then moving inland across southeast Georgia toward South Carolina early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along or very near the east-central Florida coast (around Volusia–Brevard County line)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Jupiter Inlet FL northward to the Volusia-Brevard County line FL (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Northwestern Bahamas excluding Andros Island (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: East coast of Florida, Georgia and South Carolina coastline within the 5-day cone
weather_observation.wind: Up to tropical-storm-force gusts possible (18% chance of sustained ≥34 kt winds Sunday–Monday)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None significant expected; only minor coastal flooding possible
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain totaling 2–4 inches late Saturday through Sunday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and elevated seas affecting vessel approach channels
